content.html:
Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

For questions 1–8, solve the systems of equations using the elimination method.

1. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}5x\;+\;2y\;=\;2\\-6x\;-\;2y\;=\;0\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! (–2,6)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.3.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is (–2,6). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

2. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}2x\;-\;5y\;=\;7\\-15x\;+\;5y\;=\;-85\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! (6,1)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is (6,1). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

3. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}6x\;-\;10y\;=\;-18\\25x\;+\;10y\;=\;80\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! (2,3)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.3.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is (2,3). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

4. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}-6x\;-\;16y\;=\;6\\6x\;+\;15y\;=\;-9\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! (–9,3)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is (–9,3). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

5. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}-15x\;-\;40y\;=\;-335\\15x\;+\;9y\;=\;180\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! (–9,5)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is (–9,5). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

6. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}x\;-\;3y\;=\;-9\\x\;+\;\frac52y\;=\;2\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! (–3,2)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is (–3,2). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

7. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}x\;+\;\frac13y\;=\;3\\2x\;+\;\frac13y\;=\;5\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! (2,3)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.3.2. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is (2,3). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

8. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}3x\;–\;8y\;=\;–35\\–5x\;+\;8y\;=\;45\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! (–5,2.5)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.3.2 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is (–5,2.5). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?


For questions 9–10, add the equations in the following systems of equations. What is the resulting new equation?


9. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}4x\;–\;6y\;=\;14\\–4x\;+\;y\;=\;–19\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! \(–5y = –5\)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 2.3.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(–5y = –5\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

10. \(\begin{array}{c}\left\{\begin{array}{l}3x\;–\;5y\;=\;18\\7x\;+\;5y\;=\;–8\end{array}\right.\\\\\end{array}\)

Correct! \(10x = 10\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 2.3.3 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(10 x = 10\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
